moves.1. d4: This is one of the greatest games I have played on blitz. I sacrificed FIVE pieces in order to reach a draw. Amazing! Not much commentary else to do here, just enjoy the game and its complexity.
moves.1... Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 Bg7 4. e3: A curious King's Indian formation arises. Main line is e4.
moves.4... d6 5. Bd3 O-O 6. h4: !? probably overtly aggresive. This move intends to attack before he completes his development.
moves.6... Nbd7 7. Nge2 Re8 8. Ng3 e5: Playing in the center is more important than the kingside.
moves.9. d5 Nc5 10. Bc2 Bg4: Overall this looks very good for me because of my active pieces.
moves.11. f3: 11. Nge2 runs into 11...e4! and most of the other moves are met by c6 activating the queenside pawns.
moves.11... Bd7 12. h5 Qb8: !?/?! I don't especially like this idea, but it is somewhat common and the advance c7-c6 now is quite strong because the queen guards d6. 12...a5! would be best here.
moves.13. hxg6 fxg6: ?! I don't want to open the h-file, but as it turns out, White's attack on the h-file is bound to never succeed.
moves.14. b4: ! very good. I missed it when I was playing 12...Qb8?!
moves.14... Na6 15. a3 c6 16. e4 cxd5 17. exd5: ?! taking with the c-pawn was better.
moves.18. Bd3 bxc4 19. Bxc4 Qb6 20. Bd3 e4: !! The first sacrifice of the game. This is probably definitely sound because of the tactics in the position.
moves.21. fxe4: maybe the best capture, but if anyone can tell me something better for white...
moves.26. Bxa6 Nxe4: !! The only move in this position that keeps the game going for Black.
moves.27. Ngxe4 Re8 28. Qb1: hmm...I'm a little suspicious of this move.
moves.28... Bf5 29. Bd3 Rxc3: !! Wham...another sacrifice in the basket! I wouldn't stop!
moves.30. Bxc3 Qe3+ 31. Kf1 Bxe4: I think I thought in the game I was winning here, but we shall soon find out...
moves.32. Bxe4 Bxc3: I have no idea if 32...Rxe4 was a better move, though I think  33. Rh3! might hold for White.
moves.35. gxf3 Qxf3+ 36. Kg1 Bd4+ 37. Kh2 Be5+: Here the game was agreed to a draw since White cannot stop the checks. Amazing game, thanks to alleyb, good game, and I hope you enjoyed it!

gameName: Blitz: Five Sacrifice Game and a Perpetual Draw!!!
